title: Interplanetary space
creator_credit: Bruce N. Gregory, Hugh Odishaw, Lothar Wolff and National Academy of Sciences (U.S.)
brief_description: Traces the development of space travel. Explains the importance of radar and radio astronomy in arriving at the conclusion about the activity of the Sun, its planets and some of the minor members of the solar system. considers them within the milieu of interplanetary space, a region now recognised to be an environment suffused with ionizing radiations, magnetic forces, gravitational influences, cosmic rays and the solar wind.
